page.title: 16Changes and Attitudes
page.content: The{obvious changes,}according to the elderly who live in Bourton, are the growth in{tourism,}expanding{trade}and the big increase in the{number of cars bringing with them more people. The elderly feel as though they are being pushed out of the village. There are {new housing estates}and many{existing {houses}have been{renovated}to make them habitable once more. There are many old buildings left in the village the oldest being the{Dovecot}behind the{Manor House.}Young people tend to feel much more strongly about the tourism and feel that the tourists are taking over the village by pushing them out. The elderly feel that the younger generation is outgoing, think more deeply and communicate more with their parents. The young people think that the elderly are suspicious of them yet they try to be friendly.
